It's been suggested (including by me back before I was a mod). While it seems like a good idea on the surface it kinda falls apart when you look more closely at it:

- People would bump their threads to keep them from being autolocked  

- A thread being old doesn't mean it's no longer relevant  

- Threads about mods, particularly, often still feature functional mods even if they haven't seen any action in a while

Basically, an occasional bad necro for the moderators to deal with is less bad than preventing all the valid necros and encouraging thread bumping.

I know this might be a nightmare, but is there a way to that the forum could be allowed to set up sub-threads within a thread? An example of this would be [@ZooNamedGames](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/103726-zoonamedgames/) Real Space Program, A sub-thread could be set up for each of the various missions instead of having one massively long thread with never-ending posts. The benefits would be that all related posts could be kept in each sub-thread, much the way many of us use sub-folders within our documents folders on our computers...

Just a thought.
